intro: Aulacolepis formosana, commonly known as the Formosa fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, bipinnate fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Native to Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The fronds are usually dark green and can grow up to several feet in length. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
